reviews.text: This was absolutely DELICIOUS! So glad we found it. Food was amazing, healthy and felt like it came out of your favorite Grandmaâ€™s kitchen. Canâ€™t wait to go back!

We tried the tuna kimbap and the Spicy chicken bibimbap with the stone bowl. The bowl gave the bibimbap a charred layer of rice and it was sooo good. Great portion sizes and the service was super quick. The lady working there was also really sweet and gave us complimentary bean sprout soup. The place is small but feels very cozy, def recommend!!

Amazing food, authentic Korean and very high quality!
Super friendly staff, feels homie and friendly :)
Absolutely the best food and the most kind service.

I loved this place. We got the Spicy Tuna kimbap and Spicy chicken bibimbap and it was heavenly. There is an extra 2$ charge for a hot bowl which keeps the bibimbap nice and crispy but itâ€™s totally worth it. We got our food in less than 10 mins and also received complimentary dishes. The atmosphere felt so familiar and cozy and the lady who served us was so sweet and kept checking up on us to see if we needed anything. This place is seriously 10/10!

Really small, casual place. Pretty cheap food relative to other korean spots. The owner clearly puts some effort into food presentation. Really nice staff.

The meat portions were a little small but otherwise is a great spot to grab a quick lunch or dinner. Just have normal expectations.
Iâ€™ve ordered their bibimbap as takeout twice, love the veggies that are included! (not a fan of the eggplant though personally). Comes with pickled cucumber and a hot soup.
Really like this place. Itâ€™s quaint, neighbourly and the food is fantastic.

The food is absolutely delicious!
I love to eat quickly but I had to slow down to really enjoy the flavor.

Extremely delightful and very bright interior. The women (KIM) working at the counter is very very helpful and answered every question we asked and gave us details about the items we ordered. Her communication is excellent. Overall, the wait time wasn't very long and the food was very satisfying and delicious. RECOMMEND. Thank you so much KIMğŸ™ğŸ¼
Incredible home cooked Korean food

Place is so compact and small. It will not be a good place if u go with large group. There is some kinda weird smell inside restaurant maybe because the room is so small and doesnâ€™t get enough air. Food is good, but Soondubu tastes a little bit light and expensive compared to the other Soondubu Iâ€™ve tried. If taste is better, I wouldnâ€™t mind giving a few more bucks of cuz. And it would be great if they can offer Kimchi as sides as Kimchi is the main sides for Korean restaurant, but they only serve small cucumber sides without refill.

I'm gonna call it quits with this one - theyâ€™re so hit or miss. The bulgogi kimbap is sometimes nice, but this time it tasted so off... enough that I was upset - The bulgogi tasted spoiled and pickled at the same time. Making matters worse I had the rice cake and dumpling soup and it was inedible. The dumplings tasted freezer burnt stale and ruined what would've been a nice broth.

I always order an 8oz of their fish cake and this time it tasted like a not so great burnt jerky, saturated in some salty sauce that made it inedible.

Ive never given this low of a review, (I don't believe in 1 star reviews) - this is NOT a good choice for Korean comfort food if what I was sent is considered edible and tasty. I'm flabbergasted with this meal.
Delicious authentic Korean food!! Honestly one of the best Gimbap I ever tried. Delicious beef ribs, rich in flavor. The customer service was outstanding. Definitely my fave K restaurant in the city.
Cozy restaurant with friendly service and amazing food. The portions were very generous and our favorite dish was the cheese ramen spicy rice cake. We will be coming back soon, ê°ì‚¬í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤!
Been going here for years and nothing compares to it. The staff is always friendly and attentive. The food is so delicious, especially their bulgogi over rice.

The way that this place never disappoints. I've been coming here for a few years now and it's always a wonderful experience. Be sure to get the Bibimbap in the stone bowl, cuz that charred rice is just the best!

It's a very small space, truly a mom & pop, but it adds to the cozy feel of it all. I've never had trouble getting a table though, and they've always treated me so well. Cannot recommend enough!

A bit sparce but nice.  The overall vibe is calming, relaxing, warm, and inviting.  Food is wonderful with full palette of flavor but not over the top.  Will definitely be coming back.  Fully recommend.

The chicken kalguksu was rich and comforting, with chewy noodles and a deep, flavorful broth. We also ordered a seafood pancake. It was crispy on the outside, tender inside, and full of fresh seafood
and kimchi sundubu I'm not saying anything you guys must try it everything that's three dishes and server very kindly and friendly she care about anything I'm highly recommend!

The food here is very authentic and filling. The place feels homely and the service is excellent. The space is indeed small and I think for that reason the quality of the food is also excellent. Also the complimentary soup with sprouts was so flavorful. The lady who served us was very hospitable attentive and sweet. Loved my first time experience at doma will visit again
Went with my girlfriend the other day! Good food, very casual and comforting, would recommend!
My favorite Korean restaurant. The best food and fast service. Will always come here!
The food is really good, worth the price! If you go here you should really try their seafood kalguksu, their noodles are fresh and chewy since they make it themselves. Service is good as well!ğŸ˜
Poor customer service, sent the wrong order. Ruined my lunch time.

great service, great food, especially the tteobokki and kimchi stew
Seafood Jumpong is delicious!! Fried chicken is soooo good, first hesitant with the clear light sauce but it's taste good!! Bulgogi kimbap is well fresh made!!!
A Delightful place in Sunnyside with Delicious food that feeds the heart and enriches the soul.
Delicious food, I got their kimbap.

I took a chance in ordered for lunch OMG the food was amazing I had the chicken soup fantastic and the Beef fried dumpling makes your mouth water i am so glad that  I took the chance I will definitely be ordering again and telling people about the food

Rude waiters c/o being too busy to customers who are dropping 250$ minimum. Oh the manager hates women! So disappointing as celebrating  my nieces nursing pinning celebration
Please women dining alone beware.
I have ordered Jaeyuk twice from this restaurant. Itâ€™s over $30 and they gave almost no meat both times. To charge over $30 for a meat dish and give almost no meat is ridiculous.
Very homey food at this family run establishment. We enjoyed it and will be back.
I love it, good taste and fresh.

I am a little scared of Korean food, but I tried it anyway as it claims to be Korean Comfort food.  I left very satisfied.  I got an unexpected soup and appetizer before my bento box.  It was all wonderful.  I had the teriyaki chicken and it was very special.  Not just a sliced slab of chicken breast but rather it was cute chunks integrated in a very tasty but bot spicy mix of veg and other ingredients.  I traveled from another area to pass many other restaurants before settling on this one.  It was worth it.  Prices are normal for NYC in 2024.
Hidden gem, amazing food every time.

Don't go here, but go Manhattan, Flushing or even at Mokja in Astoria. Food is way too sweet with lots of sugar in, a tiny one side dish served is joke for price they charge, thats not a Korean restaurant. Not even rice bowl served for expensive  $20-30 dish meal you order. I really don't understand so many good reviews for this restaurant at all. Never again for me!

Cute and cozy restaurant in the neighborhood. The food was good, my girlfriend especially liked the cheesy spicy rice cakes. I got the bibimbap and it was not bad! It was a busy night but the service was attentive.

Maybe I came at the wrong time, the hot chicken bibimbap was the worst Korean food among the 50+ Korean restaurants I have visited.  Eggplant , bean sprouts, chicken were all under cooked.  Ramen jajangmyeon tasted okay.
Waitress gave me a bad choice. And attitude. Threw my entire $60 rib steak away after getting nauseous from the first bite.
Food is not great for value
Best Korean food ever! Fast delivery. Always a great choice!
Very decent Korean joint in sunny side. Prices are good compared to other Koreans in queens but the space is very limited and the food is ok. Nothing to rave about.

I'm so glad there's such a delicious cozy small Korean restaurant in our neighborhood. It's a gem! The cheese teokbokki and pork feet (jokbal) here were probably the best I've ever tried, so much better than what could be found in Ktown. Sometimes, I grab kimbab as quick lunch from here and it's great. When the weather is cooler either in the spring or fall, I also enjoy sitting outdoor and have their soup & rice! I tried their hot & spicy veggie and meat stew and it was so flavorful and comforting.
I love their avocado kimbap! I go there 2x a month to get the kimbap. I love the soup that comes with all their meals. The staff is super friendly and helpful. I wish they had more vegan options.

Really expensive but good food
Itâ€™s a very cute place. The person working was really generous and helpful! The food was delish. I especially enjoyed the spicy sauce alongside the boneless chicken.
Ordered to go the spicy rice cakes, bulgogi kimbap and kalbi. They were all soo good but my fave is the kimbap. I will be trying out their other dishes.

I like coming here for the kimbap, and usually get a take out for lunch.  I would usually give it a 4* but got a take out today with fried wings and boneless chicken set and the chicken came without the sauce! Korean fried chicken is just not the same without sauces.  So a bit of a let down.

Korean approved restaurant

ê°€ê²©ì €ë ´í•˜ê³  ë§›ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

Don't know if there was a change in ownership, management, chef, supplies or what, but this restaurant has improved a lot.  Had the tteokbokki, and the spicy jokbal.  I recommend both, in particular the spicy jokbal if you like your food "exciting." it's essentially jokbal tossed in a spicy sweet and savory sauce then grilled/roasted so things get all caramelized and extra delicious.  I used to typically come here for the kimbap, which are made fresh to order.  Those are always a hit at parties. Don't get the sad old pre-made ones from hmart.  Get kimbap that someone made an effort to make, get them here.

The food was absolutely delicious! This was my second time going and i had the same server Kim, both times and she was wonderful and hospitable! I would recommend this restaurant a million times and then some!
Environment is nice. It is small but cozy. I like the decoration. Food is authentic and nice. Free kimchi appetizer like most Korean restaurant offer. Overall Doma is a good neighborhood dine spot.
I really like this place! The seafood tofu soup is amazing! The rice bowls are also delicious.â€¦

I have been to this restaurant several times with my Korean friend who knows what Korean food taste best. Their food taste great. I was never disappointed by their service and quality of food. The price is reasonable. It has clean environment. If you have larger group, it might not be the best place as it is small, cozy and has limited seating place.
The complimentary soup with Kimchi in side is always makes you feel good.

Their Korean dumplings taste good. If you are looking for something fulfilling.. then try Bulgogi Ddugbalgi Bibimbap which is great.

If you donâ€™t like water with fresh lemon in it, you need to ask her for plain water.

Itâ€™s located in very convenient location. Closer to subway train station, just less than 2 minutes walking.

Try it, you wonâ€™t regret!!

I really like this place. The dining room area is small but very clean and very neat. The staff was very accommodating and helpful. My wife and I each had a soup, both were delicious. The tea we had was excellent as well, and unexpectedâ€¦

Spicy ramen, jjambbong is really delicious!!! People who like spicy food will love it! Other menu also really good. Owner and staffs are always so nice and friendly whenever I go there. Highly recommended!!!
Wanted tofu soup and came to Doma. They had outdoor seating and hot soup countered out the chilly weather while sitting outside.â€¦
Nice and cozy Korean joint. They serve a lot of traditional Korean dishes plus some with their own fusion spin. Very rich and spicy. Veg, beef, chicken, pork and seefood is all available.

They were so amazing to serve us in the pouring rain. We all LOVED what we ate. I had a lot of leftovers I canâ€™t wait to eat tonight. Seafood pancake and sushi were amazing. Glass noodles as well and the braised beef. Yum! Waiter was lovely

Really not sure how this place has the reviews it does. Firstly, let's get to the food. We ordered the soy/garlic wings and "spicy" wings. They gave us the hot sauce and overall, both wings were way too sweet than the flavours they state.â€¦

This was my first experience with fresh made Korean food, and it was absolutely amazing. As someone who quite enjoys the pop culture aspects of Korean culture, like the dramas or kpop, I have definitely seen and heard a lot of what I ordered get eaten through a screen. The real life experience is the times better. There is a lot of flavor in each of these meals, that lend itself to a desire to take your time deciphering and enjoying them. The spicy tuna kimbap was by far my favorite, but as someone who likes cooked sushi rolls more than anything, I might have been biased toward kimbap. That being said, it's a delicious roll of cooked food that once again brought the flavor to the next level. When I'm back in new york, I would love to go again! The waitress I had was very kind, and helped me to understand what it was I was enjoying or what the differences were in different styles of what I ordered. Very enjoyable experience.

This is my favorite restaurant in the entire world. My favorite meal is Bulgogi Bibimbap with the bean sprout soup and kimchi. I lived down on 40th street in Sunnyside for 5 years and frequented Doma every other week, sometimes 2-3 times in a week. I would come in by myself after work, on weekends, or whenever I wanted to treat myself. I always ordered the same meal with the same server, and the incredible food always hit the spot. I get emotional thinking about the memories I made here as it was the first place I felt truly comfortable to eat in the restaurant by myself in silence, just to appreciate and enjoy the experience and the food. I canâ€™t convey how special Doma is in words, but I hope this photo will show a small piece of it. My husband and I moved out of NYC during the pandemic and for my birthday, he commissioned a local NYC artist to paint this favorite memory of my favorite meal at this favorite restaurant of mine. It brings tears to my eyes whenever I see it, and I wanted to share it with you. Please support this small business, thank the owner, pay in cash, and tip heavily. They deserve it and you will leave with a belly full of delicious, comforting food and already looking forward to planning your next visit. Enjoy â¤ï¸
It is a small place but the food is good and the price is fair. The hot tea there is great too!

If your food is wrong, they don't take any responsibility. I sent back my food and asked for a new dish. They told me that they do not give me a new dish because they don't want to use new ingredients. Then I asked for their solution. Theyâ€¦
A small and cozy restaurant for a simple yet tasty bite. Has a decent number of vegetarian options. The bibimbamp, in particular, is really nice.
The lady that serves there is very polite and very nice. They serve good food and I enjoy my food there everytime I eat there. Cheap and affordable.
